topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0: Applying the Pre-deployment (Horizon) Patch

section.p: Before you perform the installation of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0, you need to execute the steps below to to apply a pre-deployment patch as a prerequisite for the installation process.

The patch application invloves the following tasks:
Step 1: Bring Up Controller-0 in the KVM Region
Step 2: Applying Horizon Patch

section.title: Step 1: Bring Up Controller-0 in the KVM Region
section.p: For installing controller-0 on a baremetal system with no OS:

ol.li: On your IE browser ( recommended IE 11), enter the IP address to access the iLO console.
Login with your unique iLO user name and password associated with your server.
The initial overview of the iLO console is displayed.
Select Remote Console on the left hand side of the ILO interface and click Launch.
A "Security Warning" window appears, click Run to run the iLO remote console application.
The "iLO Integrated Remote Console" application window is displayed.
Select the "Virtual Drives" to mount the image file (CD-ROM/DVD).

Select the Titanium-Server-host-installer-16.10-b5.iso and click Open.Refer to titanium_server_planning_1610.pdf and preferably titanium_server_installation_for_systems_with_dedicated_storage_1610.pdf for server/network planning and installation respectively. For other modes of installation, refer to the installation documents.
After mounting the iso file, select the "Momentary Press" under "Power Switch" menu.
If you pressed F11 to navigate to the boot menu and chose to boot the ISO file through the virtual drive, then you will be directed to the installer wizard.

section.p: You can apply customer-specific branding by including a branding tarball.
For more information on creating the branding tarball, see the instructions in the hos_theme_v1.1.tgz in the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade SDK tarball.

This component contains instructions and examples for adding custom branding to the Horizon GUI. You can modifythe existing style sheet, font, and image files to develop your own branding, and then apply the branding by installinga tarball that includes the modified files along with a manifest.
The branding tarball can be applied at various stages. The steps for each stage are described below.
section.note: The recommended method is to install the tarball before running the controller configuration script.

ol.li: Log into the active controller using the CLI.
Delete any previous tarball from the /opt/branding directory.
Copy the new branding tarball to the /opt/branding directory.

Install the branding.
To install the branding as part of initial system configuration, run the configuration controller script.
If you have already run the controller configuration script, you can install the branding as follows:
Ensure that any previous tarballs are deleted from the /opt/branding directory.
Ensure that the new branding tarball is copied to the /opt/branding directory.
Execute the following command: sudo service horizon restart
This processes the branding files on the active controller.
Lock the inactive controller.
Unlock the inactive controller.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: Refer to the deployment guides and instructions to deploy Helion Openstack Carrier Grade 4.0 successfully.
